CatDescriptText: David Oates, barber, 2526 Wylie Avenue and Robert Holmstrom, commercial artist, Duquesne, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, April 9, 1960, pg. 29 with question "Do you believe the moral standards of our community have deteriorated since World War II?"  Mr. Oates' answer reads: "Yes because of the aftermath of the war."  Mr. Holmstrom's answer reads: "Definitely, but I don't know why."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of David Oates wearing hat with dark stripe, moustache, and tweed coat, standing in front of speckled granite wall; Portrait of Robert Holmstrom wearing eyeglasses, moustache, and plaid suit jacket, smoking cigarette, standing in front of window with light colored curtains
